content.raw:
Here’s the fix commit: [https://github.com/RobotLocomotion/drake/pull/12061/commits/a49f07a5fd365f76cd07a5f179357b1fa30d5fb6](https://github.com/RobotLocomotion/drake/pull/12061/commits/a49f07a5fd365f76cd07a5f179357b1fa30d5fb6)

I’ve made a commit which expects an error message which expected “world” to be mentioned, and currently breaks:

[https://github.com/RobotLocomotion/drake/pull/12061/commits/9cd9afeba519c643af4099e2ba9525d759b0ffdf](https://github.com/RobotLocomotion/drake/pull/12061/commits/9cd9afeba519c643af4099e2ba9525d759b0ffdf)

Is it feasible to update this error message to mention “world”?

‌
